@graph.@id: Verizon Communications Inc. v. Law Offices of Curtis V. Trinko, LLP
@graph.involvedParties: Verizon Communications Inc., Law Offices of Curtis V. Trinko, LLP
@graph.reasoning: Respondent, the plaintiff in this case, is a local telephone service customer of AT&T. Its complaint alleges that it has received unsatisfactory service because Verizon has engaged in conduct that adversely affects AT&T's ability to serve its customers, in violation of ยง 2 of the Sherman Act. 15 U. S. C. ยง 2.

@graph.@id: Associated Gen. Contractors of Cal., Inc. v. Carpenters
@graph.involvedParties: Associated Gen. Contractors of Cal., Inc., Carpenters
@graph.reasoning: In such cases, 'the importance of avoiding either the risk of duplicate recoveries on the one hand, or the danger of complex apportionment of damages on the other,' weighs heavily against a literal reading of ยง 4.

@graph.@id: Southern Pacific Co. v. Darnell-Taenzer Lumber Co.
@graph.involvedParties: Southern Pacific Co., Darnell-Taenzer Lumber Co.
@graph.reasoning: Our interpretation of ยง 4 has thus adhered to Justice Holmes' observation that the 'general tendency of the law, in regard to damages at least, is not to go beyond the first step.'

@graph.@id: Blue Shield of Va. v. McCready
@graph.reasoning: Respondent contends that its injuries were, like the plaintiff's injuries in Blue Shield of Va. v. McCready, 'the very means by which... [Verizon] sought to achieve its illegal ends.'

@graph.@id: Steel Co. v. Citizens for Better Environment
@graph.involvedParties: Steel Co., Citizens for Better Environment
@graph.reasoning: Our disposition makes it unnecessary to consider petitioner's alternative contention that respondent lacks antitrust standing.
